title: How to Activate Windows XP Without a Genuine Product Key

steps.title: Hold down ⊞ Win and tap R.
steps.content: Hold down ⊞ Win and tap R . This will open the "Run" program from which you can access your PC's registry.

steps.title: Type "regedit" into the Run field.
steps.content: Type "regedit" into the Run field. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Press ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Press ↵ Enter . Doing so will launch the Registry Editor tool.

steps.title: Review the options tree on the left side of your screen.
steps.content: Review the options tree on the left side of your screen. You'll need to navigate through several of the folders listed here in order to reach your destination. [2] X Research source Since the registry holds most of your computer's sensitive system information, consider clicking File and then Export in the top left corner of your screen to back up your registry before proceeding.

steps.title: Expand the "HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE" folder.
steps.content: Expand the "HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE" folder. Note that you'll need to click the + sign to the left of the folder to expand it--don't click the folder itself. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Expand the "SOFTWARE" folder.
steps.content: Expand the "SOFTWARE" folder. Each folder you need to expand after this point will be inside of the previous folder (for example, "SOFTWARE" was inside of "HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE" and so on).

steps.title: Expand the "Microsoft" folder.
steps.content: Expand the "Microsoft" folder.

steps.title: Expand the "Windows NT" folder.
steps.content: Expand the "Windows NT" folder. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Expand the "CurrentVersion" folder.
steps.content: Expand the "CurrentVersion" folder. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Click the "WPA Events" folder.
steps.content: Click the "WPA Events" folder. Don't expand this one. You should see its contents listed in a window on the right side of the Registry Editor page. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Right-click the "OOBETimer" entry.
steps.content: Right-click the "OOBETimer" entry.

steps.title: Click Modify.
steps.content: Click Modify .

steps.title: Select the "OOBETimer" contents.
steps.content: Select the "OOBETimer" contents. These should be several pairs and sequences of random numbers. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Delete.
steps.content: Tap Delete . This should remove the values listed here.

steps.title: Type in new numbers.
steps.content: Type in new numbers. It doesn't matter what you put here, but you'll need to keep the format consistent (for example, if you deleted four characters, you'll need to replace that section with four characters).

steps.title: Click OK once you're done.
steps.content: Click OK once you're done. This will save your changes.

steps.title: Exit the Registry Editor tool.
steps.content: Exit the Registry Editor tool.

steps.title: Open the Run tool again.
steps.content: Open the Run tool again. Remember, you can hold ⊞ Win and tap R to do so.

steps.title: Type "%systemroot%\system32\oobe\msoobe.exe /a" into the Run window.
steps.content: Type " %systemroot%\system32\oobe\msoobe.exe /a " into the Run window. Exclude the quotation marks. Entering this command opens the Windows XP activation wizard. For best results, simply copy and paste this text into the Run field.

steps.title: Click OK.
steps.content: Click OK .

steps.title: Select the telephone option.
steps.content: Select the telephone option. This option should say "Yes, I want to telephone a customer service representative to activate Windows" and there should be a clickable check box to the left of it. If you see a note that says "Windows XP is already activated", changing your key manually isn't working. Please proceed to the Windows Key Finder method.

steps.title: Click Next.
steps.content: Click Next .

steps.title: Click Change Product Key.
steps.content: Click Change Product Key . This is at the bottom of the "Activate" window.

steps.title: Enter a Windows XP product key.
steps.content: Enter a Windows XP product key. Note that you may have to attempt this step a few times with different keys. If you don't know the version of Windows XP your computer is currently running, consult your computer's manual to verify before you proceed with trying the linked product keys.

steps.title: Click Update.
steps.content: Click Update . This will generate a new Windows XP ID for your computer. After this process completes, you'll need to confirm your activation of Windows XP.

steps.title: Click Back.
steps.content: Click Back .

steps.title: Check the "Activate Windows over the Internet" option.
steps.content: Check the "Activate Windows over the Internet" option. This will allow you to activate your version of XP quickly. Note that calling Microsoft using the "telephone a customer representative" option likely won't work since Microsoft discontinued support for Windows XP on April 8th, 2014.

steps.title: Follow the on-screen instructions.
steps.content: Follow the on-screen instructions. After you've completed your Windows XP activation, you should be able to use it without getting locked out of the system.

steps.title: Open the Winkey Finder website.
steps.content: Open the Winkey Finder website . Winkey Finder is a free, no-install program that can locate and retrieve your Windows XP product key.

steps.title: Click on the latest version of Winkey Finder.
steps.content: Click on the latest version of Winkey Finder. As of January 2017, this is version 2.0. Since this version is currently in beta, you can also download the final version of 1.75.

steps.title: Click Download Winkey Finder.
steps.content: Click Download Winkey Finder . You should see this button at the bottom of the Winkey version page.

steps.title: Right-click the Winkey folder.
steps.content: Right-click the Winkey folder. It should be wherever you chose to save it when you clicked Download (e.g., your Desktop).

steps.title: Click Extract All.
steps.content: Click Extract All . Doing so will extract the locked file's contents onto your desktop.

steps.title: Double-click the Winkey Finder folder.
steps.content: Double-click the Winkey Finder folder. This is the one you just extracted.

steps.title: Double-click the Win Keyfinder program.
steps.content: Double-click the Win Keyfinder program. It should be the only executable (".exe") file in this folder.

steps.title: View your product key.
steps.content: View your product key. Running the Winkey Finder program should immediately display your Windows XP product key, allowing you to apply the key to the Windows XP activation wizard the next time Windows asks you to update. To be safe, be sure to write down the product key when you see it.

steps.title: Restart your computer.
steps.content: Restart your computer. You can choose this option from the Start menu, or you can simply hold down your computer's power button until it turns itself off and then press the button again.

steps.title: Tap F8 as soon as your computer logo appears.
steps.content: Tap F8 as soon as your computer logo appears. You'll need to do this during the first time the logo appears after rebooting. Keep tapping F8 until you see the advanced options menu pop up.

steps.title: Use the arrow keys to select Safe Mode with Command Prompt.
steps.content: Use the arrow keys to select Safe Mode with Command Prompt . Starting up your computer in this mode will bypass the Windows activation loop long enough for you to reset the timer for your XP trial.

steps.title: Tap ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Tap ↵ Enter . You'll need to wait a minute or so for Safe Mode to load.

steps.title: Type "explorer.exe" into the Command Prompt program.
steps.content: Type " explorer.exe " into the Command Prompt program. Exclude the quotation marks.

steps.title: Tap ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Tap ↵ Enter . You should see a dialogue window pop up after doing so. You may need to wait for a minute or so before the window comes up.

steps.title: Click Yes.
steps.content: Click Yes . This may also say OK . After doing so, you should notice that your desktop interface is now accessible.

steps.title: Hold down ⊞ Win and tap R.
steps.content: Hold down ⊞ Win and tap R . This will bring up the Run tool from which you can complete the fix.

steps.title: Type "rundll32.exe syssetup,SetupOobeBnk" without the quotation marks.
steps.content: Type " rundll32.exe syssetup,SetupOobeBnk " without the quotation marks. This command resets the Windows XP trial clock to 30 days.

steps.title: Click OK.
steps.content: Click OK .

steps.title: Restart your computer.
steps.content: Restart your computer. When your welcome screen finishes loading, you should be able to log in like usual rather than being stuck in the activation loop.
